result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:03 AM Defendant Bradley T. Turonie appeared by video, in custody at Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Jessica J Prado appeared by video for Bradley T. Turonie.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given. Victim rights complied with Victim is not present.  Court addresses the parties as to the status of the case   Attorney and Deft are places in a breakout room to discuss a recent offer. Back on the record at 10:08 am.  Court addresses the defense attorney  State gives status of the case.   If the next hearing is going to be a Plea and Sentencing all the necessary paperwork needs to be filed with the court.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: No contact with the victim or victim's residence - Court allows a 1 time basis escort with law enforcement to collect belongings

1:41 PM - Case called.  Defendant Bradley T. Turonie appeared in court by video without counsel, in custody at the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. State has complied with victim rights.  State was not able to reach victim.  Court asks if there are any victims present that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of Defendant.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court recuses on this matter - Once a new Judge is assigned this matter will be set for a scheduling conference.
